Description

Julia is a programming language designed for technical computing that combines ease-of-use of dynamical languages, like Python, and high-performance of statically-compiled languages, like C. Its most notable feature is multiple dispatch, which greatly simplifies the definition of complex functions whose behavior depends on the type of the arguments.

The JuliaAstro organization aims at providing to astronomers the tools to work with the Julia language: there are libraries for manipulation of FITS files, transformation of coordinates, cosmological calculations, time system conversions, and computation of dust extinction laws.

One of the latest packages is AstroImages.jl, which will allow researchers to visualize astronomical images coming from FITS files. This package is now in its infancy and has very basic features, the goal of this project is to expand it and make it more useful. AstroImages.jl has not been officially registered yet, thus you will be able to freely make any breaking change.

Expected Outcomes

  • Design and implement the user interface
  • Support visualization of multiple extensions (e.g., three extensions combined with RGB)
  • Integrate with WCS info (accessible via WCS.jl)
  • Integrate with common visualization and plotting frameworks in Julia, like Images.jl, Plots.jl, and optionally Makie.jl
  • Ensure smooth integration with Jupyter notebooks (basic integration is already in place)
  • Write documentation and tests
